posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:

Rating:

posts.post_content:
To balance this out, you would have to pay half of your life to activate it, or something that delayed you from using it too soon (suspend, return lands, etc) like the "fixed lotus" versions out there. Of course, ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) cost would help, as would lowering the mana it gives to CMC 1. At that point, you could just have this come into play tapped, and it's suitable to not require sacrifice of it.  
  
Modern-era Lotus:  
![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)  
Legendary Artifact  
"M.E. Lotus" can not cost less than ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol), for any reason.  
Comes into play tapped.  
T: Add any color of mana to your mana pool, play this ability only ONCE each turn.  
  
I fixed it!  
  
It's on par with [Command Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Command Tower), [Ancient Ziggurat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Ziggurat), [City of Brass](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=City of Brass), etc.
